Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Two fragments of Arabic commentaries on the books of Pentateuch.

msItem.title: Commentary on the books of Exodus and Deuteronomy.

collation.p:
The quires divided into 2 parts: 18 quires of 10 leaves each (folios 1-159, nos. 8-14, 19-27, 31-32) and 7 quires of 10 leaves each (folios 160-205, nos. 4-5, 8-9, 11, 13-14).
Quires nos. 8, 9, 19, 22, 25, 26, 27, 31 of the 1st part, and nos. 4, 5, 8, 9, 13 of the 2nd part are defective.
Signatures in Arabic letters on the first page of a quire, and with Arabic letters on the first page of the four following folios.
Fragment of a single quire.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Two different Naskhi hands of 11th to 13th century, and Oriental square script of 12th to 13th century. A Naskhi hand of approximately 11th century. An Arabic Naskhi script (large, bold) and Hebrew (Oriental) square of approximately 12th to 13th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine title: 'Commentary on Exodus and Deuteronomy. Arabic. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2558.'

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), a antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 08 July 1882, folio [213v].
